content.title: AICTE-Margdarshan scheme
content.beneficiary: Mentee Beneficiary Institutes and Mentor Institute
content.details: Margdarshan Initiative has been introduced by All India Council for Technical Education in 2018 for facilitating the technical institutes in order to improve the quality of technical education as a whole through accreditation by providing access to the facilities available in host institute. This Initiative is a facilitative mechanism that aims to foster & augment the support ecosystem in the Institutes approved by AICTE for enhancing their quality across all domains.
benefits: The Council has made provisions of a token grant in aid of ₹ 3,00,000/- per MBI. Hence a maximum ₹ 30,00,000/- can be sanctioned to an MI for conducting activities under the Margdarshan Scheme for 10 MBIs altogether.
Suitable honorarium to staff engaged in running the scheme.
eligibility: The institution must have been approved by AICTE.
For MI, accreditation status must be valid for at least 6 months from the date of submission of the proposal.
Only AICTE approved institutes are eligible to receive mentoring from MIs.
exclusions: AICTE approved institutions having break in extension of approval or no admission in the institute for any reason in the last 10 years shall not be considered.
An institution cannot submit more than one project proposal for MI scheme.
content.application_process: Offline. An institute seeking MI status will be required to forward an application signed from head of the institute along with the detailed project report (DPR).
documents_required: Number of MBIs proposed in the Detailed Project Report (DPR)
Consent of all MBIs proposed in DPR
Programme wise Pre-Qualifiers for each MBI

faqs.question: What is Margdarshan scheme?
faqs.answer: Margdarshan Initiative has been introduced by All India Council for Technical Education for facilitating the technical institutes in order to improve the quality of technical education as a whole through accreditation by providing access to the facilities available in host institute.

faqs.question: Who manages this scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme is managed by All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE).
